article:
'Cocamide DEA', or 'cocamide diethanolamine', is a diethanolamide made by
reacting the mixture of fatty acids from coconut oils with diethanolamine. {{cite web
| last = Therapeutic Goods Administration first = authorlink = coauthors = title
| = Chemical Substances work = publisher = date = url =
| http://www.tga.gov.au/docs/pdf/aan/aanchem.pdf format = doi = accessdate = 20
| June 2009}} It is a viscous liquid and is used as a foaming agent in
| bath products like shampoos and hand soaps, and in cosmetics as an emulsifying
| agent. See cocamide for the discussion of the lengths of carbon chains in the
| molecules in the mixture. The chemical formula is CH 3(CH 2) nC(=O)N(CH 2CH 2OH) 2, where n can
| vary depending on the source of fatty acids.
